text:
Today we’re launching out of stealth Cognichip Inc., a company building the world’s first Artificial Chip Intelligence (ACI®) to modernize chip design.

After 40+ years in this industry, building chips, taking companies public, and watching startups disappear, I’ve seen firsthand how innovation is being stifled by chip development time, cost, and complexity.

#ACI, built on the first-of-its-kind physics-informed foundation model for semiconductors, makes chip development dramatically faster, cheaper, and more accessible.

We’ve assembled a dream team to bring this vision to life. Ehsan Kamalinejad Simon Sabato Mehdi Daneshpanah Stelios Diamantidis. Alumni of Amazon, Google, Apple, Synopsys, Aquantia, and KLA.

Thank you to our visionary investors for backing our mission. Lux Capital Mayfield FPV Ventures Candou Ventures

Let’s be pioneers again.

AI isn’t just shaping our tools, it’s shaping our values.


This week on AI Ascent, I unpack the real-world impact of biased algorithms, predictive AI, and how machines are redefining work, health, and human decision-making. 

If you care about the future of tech, ethics, and empowerment this one’s for you.

Artificial Intelligence (A.I.) is rapidly reshaping how we search for information. From Google’s AI Overviews to standalone A.I.-powered search engines, the promise is clear: instant, summarized answers to any question. But beneath the convenience lies a growing concern-A.I. search engines are fundamentally flawed, and relying on them as your primary source of truth can be risky.

AI and ... the courtroom?


In a groundbreaking instance of artificial intelligence intersecting with the legal system, 

the family of Christopher Pelkey, a U.S. Army veteran tragically killed in a 2021 road-rage incident, utilized AI to bring his voice back to the courtroom. 

During the sentencing of his killer in May 2025, they presented an AI-generated video featuring a lifelike avatar of Pelkey delivering a heartfelt message. 

This innovative approach aimed to convey the emotional impact of his loss in a way that traditional victim statements could not.

This case underscores the expanding boundaries of generative AI, venturing beyond conventional applications into deeply personal and emotional territories. 

It prompts us to reflect on the ethical considerations and potential of AI in areas we might not have previously imagined.


What's YOUR experience with AI?
Feel free to share a comment about how it's helping (or hurting) you.


#genai #dunDUN

Haris Silic has spent more than 15 years as a top recruitment executive for creative staff and executives at Artisan Talent and has had unique insight into many industry wide job market trends. 
Right now, he is warning that many of us are missing a key narrative in the employment market for creative workers. 
It is not artificial intelligence that leaders and prospective job seekers should be fretting about, Silic says. In fact, AI is a key tool that creative workers should embrace and learn. It is actually the offshoring of talent by American creative leaders that should be of more concern, he notes. 
While creative leaders have been incessantly talking about the impact of artificial intelligence, Silic argues that this is "a bit of a decoy." 
There are some fascinating insights here from an executive with deep experience in the market.
